channel.title: Computer for my Grandparents - Christmans Present
channel.description:
Well anyway I'm building a computer for my grandparents for Christmas and it has to be relatively cheap because my parents don't have a lot of money ATM until my Dad gets paid, plus im donating my Christmas money to this so don't call me a selfish bastard for saying that I want to be able to play games on it when I come to visit. Anyway the budget is under $500 dollars. Im have what I want to get but tell me your opinions on everything and on anything that is similar performance and is cheaper. I'm going with intel because I want to be able to overclock too 3.2 GHZ easily so that's that. Plus this processor has Virtualization Technology Support.
Processor - [url=http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16819116265]Intel Celeron E3200 Wolfdale 2.4GHz 1MB L2 Cache[/url]: Im getting this to overclock to 3.2 GHZ which will be good for the price I paid. - $52.99
Motherboard - [url=http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16813128359]GIGABYTE GA-EP45-UD3R[/url]: Wanted a normal sized ATX motherboard give me your ideas on any of the other Gigabyte ones. $119.99 - $15 - $104.99
PSU - OCZ ModXStream Pro 500 Watt: I cannot have anything but a modular power supply and this is modular and cheap with good mail-in rebate. - 59.99 - 25 = $34.99
RAM - CORSAIR XMS2 4GB (2 x 2GB) 240-Pin DDR2 SDRAM DDR2 1066: Good Corsair ram with GREAT REBATE. - 94.99 - 15 = $79.99
Video Card - [url=http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16814261051&cm_re=GTS250-_-14-261-051-_-Product]Palit nVidia GTS 250 512MB 256-bit GDDR3[/url]: Good video card for the price: Suggestions for ATI Card that is same performace but cheaper needs good heatsink $109.99
Hard Drive: [url=http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16822136319]Western Digital 640GB[/url] - Bought this one before and its good quality - $49.99
TOTAL: 432.94
Case: Not sure give me suggestions need to be black and I would prefer a side window.
CD/DVD Rom drive: Not sure yet looking

item.title: Computer for my Grandparents - Christmans Present
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

For the record, Ive got all the stuff and I put it together once, but I returned the Harddrive for a WD Green one because the WD Blue one was really loud, and I bought a new heatsink because the intel stock one was loud and shit, I also returned the ram and bought different ram because the GSKILL Ripjaw ram I bought was 1333MHZ but max it would run was 800MHZ so I bought GSKILL ram from the supported memory list. While I am waiting I stripped all the parts out of the case and I stripped the case down. I am getting a air compressor cutting disk and some more uchannel trimming, and black textured spray paint. I am cutting holes for cable mangment and I am painting the whole interior/back panel of case black. Pictures will be here when I’m finished.

Read full topic
item.source: Computer for my Grandparents - Christmans Present

item.title: Computer for my Grandparents - Christmans Present
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“T4_, post:16, topic:316333”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=412900.msg3045140#msg3045140 date=1259426457]

Virtual PC is alot different than it was before, now you don’t have to install XP yourself it is installed when you install it on windows 7. Check out the video on that page.

Just based on licensing issues and how greedy Micro$oft is, somehow I doubt that
[/quote]Actually Windows XP-mode runs a virtual image of XP which is free from microsoft

Interesting, I wasn’t aware of this feature. Ps, I had to install 7 on my new rig . And… in all honesty it isn’t that bad; however, I’d never use it for a workstation operating system.[/quote]Its pretty much the same as Vista in it’s current state.

Read full topic
item.source: Computer for my Grandparents - Christmans Present

item.title: Computer for my Grandparents - Christmans Present
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

i don’t see why you need a CPU that supports virtualization, or the need to over clock, or the need to get a GTS250 when this computer is for your grandparents who will be happy playing solitaire.

Read full topic

item.title: Computer for my Grandparents - Christmans Present
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:15, topic:316333”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=412900.msg3045131#msg3045131 date=1259426027]

Virtual PC is alot different than it was before, now you don’t have to install XP yourself it is installed when you install it on windows 7. Check out the video on that page.

Just based on licensing issues and how greedy Micro$oft is, somehow I doubt that
[/quote]Actually Windows XP-mode runs a virtual image of XP which is free from microsoft :P[/quote]
Interesting, I wasn’t aware of this feature. Ps, I had to install 7 on my new rig . And… in all honesty it isn’t that bad; however, I’d never use it for a workstation operating system.

item.source: Computer for my Grandparents - Christmans Present

item.title: Computer for my Grandparents - Christmans Present
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I have used Virtual PC in XP to run 98 with it, but since then I’ve used virtualbox under both windows and linux and it simply runs much better, has many more options, runs many more operating systems and, of course, is open source. Also virtualbox supports hardware acceleration as of 3.0, I don’t know if Virtual PC does or not.

Read full topic
item.source: Computer for my Grandparents - Christmans Present

item.title: Computer for my Grandparents - Christmans Present
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:8, topic:316333”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=412900.msg3042623#msg3042623 date=1259237754]

Whatever you do don’t use Microsoft Virtual PC, it’s a horrible program. Virtualbox is much better and VMWare is also good.
[/quote]Uhh, exactly what’s so bad about Virtual PC (beside the fact you can only emulate Windows os’s)?

Your talking to mitb.
But being serious I used to use Virtual PC (now use virtual box) and it was fine. Some linux OS’s do run in it- just not the mainstream ones. Yes it is closed source and platform dependant but if you just want to emulate windows on windows it fits the bill perfectly.[/quote]
Virtualbox runs on a lot, if not all distros…

Read full topic

item.description:

Great harddrive is out of stock, best deal of them all with 32mb cache 640gb only 49.99 the only other one is wit a 16mb cache and its 69.99. Big difference, guess ill be going with a 320Gb one.

item.title: Computer for my Grandparents - Christmans Present
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:6, topic:316333”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=412900.msg3042337#msg3042337 date=1259205145]
Whatever you do don’t use Microsoft Virtual PC, it’s a horrible program. Virtualbox is much better and VMWare is also good.
[/quote]Uhh, exactly what’s so bad about Virtual PC (beside the fact you can only emulate Windows os’s)?[/quote]
Your talking to mitb.
But being serious I used to use Virtual PC (now use virtual box) and it was fine. Some linux OS’s do run in it- just not the mainstream ones. Yes it is closed source and platform dependant but if you just want to emulate windows on windows it fits the bill perfectly.

Read full topic

@Abraham 2x2GB at 1066 is never below $90 unless you get a rebate such as I will, I think your thinking of 667 or maybe newegg just raised their prices idk. Lowest is 90.99 from newegg.http://www.newegg.com/Product/ProductList.aspx?Submit=ENE&N=2010170147%201052108080%201052420643%201052315794&name=4GB%20(2%20x%202GB)

Plus this processor has Virtualization Technology Support.

Yeah, my grandparents run a lot of virtual machines too. Good choice.
[/quote] Really! Wow thats suprising anyway I think your being sarcastic and I choose so because im going to upgrade them to Windows 7 and if they cant figure it out they can just open up XP virutal machine. http://www.microsoft.com/windows/virtual-pc/

Whatever you do don’t use Microsoft Virtual PC, it’s a horrible program. Virtualbox is much better and VMWare is also good.[/quote]Uhh, exactly what’s so bad about Virtual PC (beside the fact you can only emulate Windows os’s)?

I’m going with intel because I want to be able to overclock too 3.2 GHZ easily so that’s that. Plus this processor has Virtualization Technology Support.

Motherboard - GIGABYTE GA-EP45-UD3R: Wanted a normal sized ATX motherboard give me your ideas on any of the other Gigabyte ones. $119.99 - $15 - $104.99
